radiographic_examinations.findings: Open epiphyses and a bone age of only 12 years.

radiographic_examinations.date: Between age 17 yr and 20 yr and 5 months
radiographic_examinations.findings: Areal bone mineral density (BMD) improved: 23% at lumbar spine, 14% at femoral neck, and increases at one-third radius and ultradistal radius (15% and 18% respectively).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in lumbar spine and femoral neck BMD from age 17 yr and 1 month to 20 yr and 5 months.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No gain of either trabecular or cortical volumetric BMD at the ultradistal radius; however, significant increase in cross-sectional area (by 46%) and cortical thickness (by 12%) during treatment.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in cross-sectional area but no significant changes in volumetric density over the treatment period.
